sen.j: 大聖院（だいしょういん）は、京都市右京区（旧北桑田郡京北町）にある真言宗御室派の寺院。
sen.e: Daisho-in Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Omuro School located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City (formerly Keihoku-cho, Kitakuwada County)
Daisho-in Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Omuro School located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City (formerly Keihoku-cho, Kitakuwada County)
Daisho-in Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Shingon Sect Omuro School located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City (formerly Keihoku-cho, Kitakuwada-gun).
sen.cmt: Kitakuwada County→Kitakuwada-gunとし、ピリオド追加

sen.e: The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
History
History
History

sen.j: この寺の創建年代等については不詳であるが、この寺に残る十一面観音像は平安時代の作と伝えられる。
sen.e: Details surrounding the founding of Daisho-in Temple including the year in which it was established are unknown but the temple's statue of the Eleven-faced Kannon dates from the Heian Period.
Details surrounding the founding of Daisho-in Temple including the year in which it was established are unknown but the temple's statue of the Eleven-faced Kannon dates from the Heian Period.
Details surrounding the founding of Daisho-in Temple including the year in which it was established are unknown but the temple's statue of the Eleven-faced Kannon dates from the Heian period.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: その後盛衰を繰り返し、現在の姿になったのは近代以降のことである。
sen.e: It went through repeated periods of decline and prosperity before reaching its current form in the early modern period.
It went through repeated periods of decline and prosperity before reaching its current form in the early modern period.
It went through repeated periods of decline and prosperity before reaching its current form in the early modern period.

sen.j: 近畿楽寿三十三箇所第27番
sen.e: The 27th site on the Kinki Rakuju 33 Temple Pilgrimage
